chapterTitle: Introduction to Valuation:The Time Value of Money
sectionTitle: More about Present and Future Values

columns.text: In this problem, we will use a given calculator to solve for the present value of an investment.

However, since we are given a calculating software in the problem, we will simply input the time as $25$ years, the rate as $10\%$ and the future value as $\$140,000$. Doing this will give us:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\$11,611.56
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the amount that you need to invest today to get the target future value is $\$11,611.56$
